io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core

Class SmintIoSynchronization

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.SmintIoSynchronization
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISmintIoSynchronization

    public class SmintIoSynchronization
extends Object
implements ISmintIoSynchronization
    Provides initializing functions for the Smint.io synchronization process and handles the synchronization.

    Constant rate schedule

    This class will manage creating a synchronization job and will schedule it in function start(). The schedule is set to constant rate of every 60 minutes. However, in case synchronization takes longer, the next scheduled task is put into a waiting queue. The waiting queue consists of a single slot only. So any additional tasks to execute because of the schedule is ignored and discarded. The still waiting task will handle its sync assets, too.

    Dependency Injection

    Either this class is created using any dependency injection, or Google's Guice is used internally. The implementation tries to avoid to apply its own injector if there already is some in place. Only if the required instance of ISmintIoSyncFactory is not injected via Field Injection, Guice is to create these instances.

    Synchronizing job runs

    Synchronization jobs are not allowed to run simultaneously. It simple does not make sense. So new events to trigger a new job run add the new run to a waiting queue in case a job is currently running. Hence an instance of ISyncJobExecutionQueue is used to detect and handle collisions.

      • SmintIoSynchronization

        @Inject
public SmintIoSynchronization(ISyncTargetFactory syncTargetFactory)
        Create a new Smint.io synchronization process handler.

        init(ISyncTargetFactory) will try to load Google's Guice as Dependency Injection framework in order to create an instance of ISmintIoSyncFactory.

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • getFactory

      • start

        public SmintIoSynchronization start()
        Description copied from interface: ISmintIoSynchronization
        Start a scheduled synchronization, register with channel listener and store a reference with the scheduler.

        The scheduling is maintained by the implementing class. It will schedule only one process, no matter how often this method is executed. Only a new schedule is created but no sync process started.

        Along the scheduled job, the job is registered with the the channel API of Pusher.com to receive push notification in case of any purchase.

        Beware: a reference to this instance is stored with the scheduler. So as long as there is an active schedule garbage collection won't apply.

        The first job will be started immediately upon calling this method.

        Specified by:
        start in interface ISmintIoSynchronization
        Returns:
        this in order to support Fluent Interface paradigm.

      • stop

        public SmintIoSynchronization stop()
        Description copied from interface: ISmintIoSynchronization
        Stop the scheduled synchronization process.

        Only the schedule is stopped (removed) and the channel API of Pusher.com is disconnected. Any currently running synchronization process is not terminated.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface ISmintIoSynchronization
        Returns:
        this in order to support Fluent Interface paradigm.

      • triggerSync

        public Future<Void> triggerSync(boolean syncWithMetaData)
        Description copied from interface: ISmintIoSynchronization
        Perform a synchronization of all meta data and assets.

        A new synchronization task will be executed. In case such a task is already being executed, a new one will be put into the waiting queue. If there already is a job waiting for execution, no new job is being scheduled but the returned Future is going to wait for the termination of the already queued task.

        Specified by:
        triggerSync in interface ISmintIoSynchronization
        Parameters:
        syncWithMetaData - if true the sync job will synchronize the meta data too. If false, only assets are synchronized.
        Returns:
        a Future that will return null in its Future.get() function, once synchronization job has finished.

      • triggerSync

        public Future<Void> triggerSync()
        Description copied from interface: ISmintIoSynchronization
        Perform a synchronization of all meta data and assets.

        calls ISmintIoSynchronization.triggerSync(boolean) with parameter true.

        Specified by:
        triggerSync in interface ISmintIoSynchronization
        Returns:
        a Future that will return null in its Future.get() function, once synchronization job has finished.

      • init

        public SmintIoSynchronization init(ISyncTargetFactory syncTargetFactory)
        Initializes the Smint.io platform synchronization.

        An instance of Google's Guice is created as Dependency Injection system and used to create this required instance of ISmintIoSyncFactory. The Guice injector is created by calling SyncGuiceModule.createSmintIoSyncFactory(ISyncTargetFactory).

        Parameters:
        syncTargetFactory - sync target provided factory to use with this library.
        Returns:
        the first service found or null if there is none.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - in case the created factory is null or any of its factory-function return null.
